title: Avalanche Bulletin CAAMLv6 Collection
description: JSON schema for EAWS Avalanche Bulletin Collection following the CAAMLv6 schema

bulletin.title: Avalanche Bulletin
bulletin.description: Avalanche Bulletin for a given set of regions.

publicationTime.title: Publication Time
publicationTime.description: Time and Date when the Bulletin was issued by the AWS to the Public. ISO 8601 Timestamp in UTC or with time zone information.

validTime.title: Valid Time
validTime.description: Date and Time from and until this Bulletin is valid. It is recommended to issue a Bulletin for each calendar day. The Timestamps is compliant with ISO 8601 and in UTC, unless another time zone is indicated

source.title: Source
source.description: Details about the issuer/AWS of the Bulletin.

regions.title: Regions
regions.description: Collection of region elements for which this Bulletin is valid.

dangerRatings.title: Danger Ratings
dangerRatings.description: Collection of Danger Rating elements for this Bulletin.

avalancheProblems.title: Avalanche Problems
avalancheProblems.description: Collection of Avalanche Problem elements for this Bulletin.

highlights.title: Highlights
highlights.description: Contains an optional short text to highlight an exceptionally dangerous situation.

wxSynopsis.title: Weather Forecast Synopsis
wxSynopsis.description: Texts element with Highlight and Comment for weather forcast information.

avalancheActivity.title: Avalanche Activity and Avalanche Activity Forecast
avalancheActivity.description: Texts element with Highlight and Comment for the current avalanche activity and forecast.

snowpackStructure.title: Snowpack Structure
snowpackStructure.description: Texts element with Highlight and Comment for details on the Snowpack Structure.

travelAdvisory.title: Travel Advisory
travelAdvisory.description: Texts element with Highlight and Comment for travel Advisory.

tendency.title: Tendency
tendency.description: Tendency element for a detailed description of the expected avalanche situation tendency after the Bulletin's period of validity.

dangerRating.title: Danger Rating
dangerRating.description: Defines a Danger Rating, its elevation constraints and the valid time period. If validTimePeriod or elevation are constrained for a rating, it is expected to define a dangerRating for all the other cases.

dangerRatingValue.title: Danger Rating Value
dangerRatingValue.description: Danger Rating value, according to EAWS Danger Scale Definition.

avalancheProblem.title: Avalanche Problem
avalancheProblem.description: Defines an Avalanche Problem, its time, aspect, and elevation constraints. A textual detail about the affected terrain can be given in the terrainFeature field. Also, details about the expected avalanches for this problem can be defined.

avalancheProblemType.title: Avalanche Problem Type
avalancheProblemType.description: Expected Avalanche Problem, according to the EAWS Avalanche Problem Definition.

avalancheSize.title: Expected Avalanche Size
avalancheSize.description: Expected Avalanche Size, according to the EAWS definition. Integer Value from 1 (small) to 5 (extremely large).

snowpackStability.title: Expected Snowpack Stability
snowpackStability.description: Snowpack Stability, according to the EAWS definition. Four stage scale from very poor to good.

frequency.title: Expected Avalanche Frequency
frequency.description: Expected Avalanche Frequency, according to the EAWS definition. Three stage scale from few to many.

tendency.title: Avalanche Situation Tendency
tendency.description: Describes the expected tendency of the development of the Avalanche Situation.

metaData.title: Meta Data
metaData.description: Meta Data for various uses. Can be used to link to external files like Maps, Thumbnails etc.

extFile.title: External File
extFile.description: External File is used to link to external files like Maps, Thumbnails etc.

customData.title: Custom Data
customData.description: Custom Data can be used to add arbitrary additional information. There can be AWS specific Custom Data Types defined as the Tyrolian Danger Patterns. Also, every other kind of Information can be attached here.

texts.title: Texts
texts.description:
Texts contains a Highlight and a Comment string, where Highlights could also be described as a kind of Headline for the longer Comment. For Text-Formating only the HTML-Tags
for a new line and followed by for a bold text.

source.title: Avalanche Bulletin Source
source.description: Information about the Bulletin source. Either as in a person or with a provider element to specify details about the AWS.

provider.title: Avalanche Bulletin Provider
provider.description: Information about the Bulletin Provider. Defines the Name, URL and/or contactPerson (which could be the author) of the issuing AWS.

region.title: Region
region.description: Region Element describes a (micro) region. The regionID follows the EAWS schema. It is recommended to have the region shape's files with the same IDs in gitlab.com/eaws/eaws-regions. Additionally, the region name can be added.

aspects.title: Aspects
aspects.description: An Aspect can be defined as a set of aspects. The aspects are the expositions as in a eight part (45Â°) segments. The allowed aspects are the four main cardinal directions and the four intercardinal directions.

elevation.title: Elevation Boundery or Band
elevation.description: Elevation describes either an elevation range below a certain bound (only upperBound is set to a value) or above a certain bound (only lowerBound is set to a value). If both values are set to a value, an elevation band is defined by this property. The value uses a numeric value, not more detailed than 100m resolution. Additionally to the numeric values also 'treeline' is allowed.

validTime.title: Valid Time
validTime.description: Valid Time defines two ISO 8601 Timestamps in UTC, unless another time zone is indicated.

validTimePeriod.title: Valid Time Period
validTimePeriod.description: Valid Time Period can be used to limit the validity of an element to an erlier or later period. Mostly, it is used to distinguish between AM and PM Danger Ratings or to limit an avalanche Problem to the PM-Part of the Bulletin.
